Package networking.backend

Class PeerDiscovery

java.lang.Object
networking.backend.PeerDiscovery
public class PeerDiscovery
extends java.lang.Object
Performs broadcast and multicast peer detection. How well this works depends on your network configuration
Author:
ryanm

  • Field Details

    • group

      public final java.net.InetAddress group
      The group address. Determines the set of peers that are able to discover each other

    • port

      public final int port
      The port number that we operate on

    • rxExceptionHandler

      public PeerDiscovery.ExceptionHandler rxExceptionHandler
      Redefine this to be notified of exceptions on the listen thread. Default behaviour is to print to stdout. Can be left as null for no-op

  • Constructor Details

    • PeerDiscovery

      public PeerDiscovery​(java.net.InetAddress group, int port, int ttl) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs a peer and connects it to a UDP multicast group
      Parameters:
      group - a valid multicast address, i.e.: in the range 224.0.0.1 to 239.255.255.255 inclusive
      port - a valid port, i.e.: in the range 1025 to 65535 inclusive
      ttl - The time-to-live for multicast packets. 0 = restricted to the same host, 1 = Restricted to the same subnet, <32 = Restricted to the same site, organisation or department, <64 = Restricted to the same region, <128 = Restricted to the same continent, <255 = unrestricted
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • PeerDiscovery

      public PeerDiscovery​(java.net.InetAddress group, int port) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs a UDP broadcast-based peer
      Parameters:
      group - The identifier shared by the peers that will be discovered.
      port - a valid port, i.e.: in the range 1025 to 65535 inclusive
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

  • Method Details

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Signals this PeerDiscovery to shut down. This call will block until everything's timed out and closed etc.

    • sendDiscoveryPacket

      public void sendDiscoveryPacket() throws java.io.IOException
      Queries the network and finds the addresses of other peers in the same group
      Parameters:
      timeout - How long to wait for responses, in milliseconds. Call will block for this long, although you can Thread.interrupt() to cut the wait short
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If something goes wrong when sending the query packet

    • setDiscoverable

      public void setDiscoverable​(boolean discoverable)

    • getPeers

      public java.net.InetAddress[] getPeers()
